item.title: Autumn tour of Boryeong Oseosan where silver silver grass, golden field, and sunset of the West Sea blend - Boryeong, Chungnam, Korea
item.description:
Sunset from Oseo Mountain

Autumn tour of Boryeong Oseosan where silver silver grass, golden field, and sunset of the West Sea blend

Boryeong, Chungnam, Korea

Autumn has come silently, but the ripe autumn leaves still have to wait. As I wait for the autumn leaves, I go to a place where I'm impatient or the autumn breeze is overwhelming. It is a silver grass colony of Oseo Mountain in Boryeong, Chungnam. The sunset over the silver grass, the golden field and the glow of the west coast are bonuses. I loaded my body on a train on the Janghang Line and walked into the autumn.
Take a train on the Janghang Line and plow in the silver wave!
At this time when the news of the autumn leaves is heard, the silver grass that gleams with silver also attracts travelers. Oseosan, which spans Boryeong, Hongseong, and Cheongyang, Chungcheongnam-do, has a spectacular view of silver grass since early October. It is considered as one of the top five silver grass spots in the nation, along with Myeongseongsan Mountain in Pocheon-si, Gyeonggi-do, Mindongsan Mountain in Jeongseon-gun in Gangwon, Cheongwansan Mountain in Jangheung-gun, Jeollanam-do, and Sajapyeong Saegil-gil in Ulju-gun, Ulsan. One of the eight sights of Boryeong is the silver grass that stretched gently on the ridge of Oseo Mountain. It has a view of Daecheon Beach, Muchangpo and Oeyeon Islands, so you can see half the unexplored sights of Boryeong at about 8 moments on the ridge.
The golden grass of Oseosan at sunset
Oseosan is a rarely high mountain (790m above sea level) on the west coast where most of the plains are located. It is for this reason that the scenery under the feet is toxic. Standing at the summit, the sea spreads to the west and the fields of Hongseong and Cheongyang to the east.
A silver grass colony follows the 2km ridge
If you want to feel the excitement of the autumn trip, we recommend you take the slow-moving Mugunghwa Lake to the nearest station in Oseosan.
Quiet and compact cleaning station
A small bench was placed in the small waiting room, but Lee Rae-tuk also had the longest history on the Janghang line. Janghang Station, which has remained on the Janghang Line for many years, has been designated as a Korean cultural heritage.
Quiet and compact cleaning station
Standing on the platform, the gentle ridge of Oseo Mountain can be seen at a glance. As the name of 'blue place', the scenery over the railroad tracks is all over the forest and the sky. It is also a good idea to stop for a moment at the simple station in the autumn sun and feel the relaxed mood. Taxi waiting for hikers is always waiting in front of the cleaning station. It takes 10-15 minutes to reach Seongyeon Parking Lot, the head of Oseosan Mountain or Oseosan Natural Recreation Forest.
Oseosan ridge over the railroad
A forest road full of autumn mood
The heads to Oseosan silver grass colony are the counseling parking lot in Damsan-ri, Gwangcheon-eup, Hongseong-gun, the Seongyeon parking lot in Seongyeon-ri, Jangyeon-myeon, Boryeong-si, and the Oseosan natural recreation forest in Janghyeon-ri, Cheongnyeon. The shortest route to the summit of Oseosan is the Oseosan Natural Recreation Forest Course. It is good to stay overnight in a recreational forest and go up and down.
Forest experience road full of chestnuts
It is the fastest way to go straight from the management office to Woljeongsa Temple, but the path leading to Woljeongsa Temple from the forest experience route on the left side of the Forest Culture Recreation Center is even more impressive. It takes about 1 hour and 30 minutes from the forest experience route to the top of Oseo Mountain. As it is a short course, the slope is quite steep, so it is better to climb with a spare time.
Many acorns also make acorns common
The forest experience is a gentle dirt road. The hornbeam tree, the dead tree, the willow tree, and the oak tree form a dense forest to cover the sky. The green color is still widespread, but chestnuts and fallen leaves accumulate to give off the autumn mood. After passing the trail for about 20 minutes, we reach Woljeongsa Temple when the sound of the wooden voice approaches. Gujeolcho bloomed all over the small hermitage.
Autumn messenger, Gujeolcho
I hung my neck at Woljeongsa Temple and went on my way again. The pine forest lined up on both sides boasts a quiet atmosphere. Occasionally, the red-colored maple trees mark the path of autumn. When the pine forest road ends and the three-way intersection comes out, the uphill road begins in earnest. By the time you climb your steep path for 15 minutes, you can see a sign that you have 700m to the summit.
When you pass the iron staircase, a panoramic view appears.
As you climb the last gate, the iron staircase, your view finally expands. On the opposite side, the golden fields are unfolding under the stem of Seongju and the whole area of Hwaam-ri, Cheongyang-gun can be seen at a glance. Abundance of wind penetrates the whole body like the autumn field. Even the fluttering silver grass begins to catch its eye, but it is still tasteful.
Autumn field in autumn
end
When you climb the ridge and see the communication tower, the summit of Oseosan is in front of you. From here, the ridge-filled ridgeline extends for about 2 km. The silver grass that grew as tall as both sides of the trail breaks the road like an escort, and the silver grass colony waving constantly in the breeze of the sea creates a spectacular view. The silver grass, which begins to bloom from the beginning of October, peaks in mid-October by blooming whiter and more abundant flowers.
Silver grass that covered the ridge
The famous sight of Oseo Mountain is not less than that, and at this time, it is a sunset with a golden sunset. The silver grass, which shimmered in silver during the day, is golden in the evening. It is a scenery that "you can get away from all kinds of wrestling and taste the ecstasy" like the words engraved on the headstone of the summit. However, in the fall, the sun is short, so it is better to go down as quickly as possible.
Hiker looking at sunset
The river line flowing from Boryeong dyke to the West Sea can be seen at a glance over the field. On fine days, Daecheon Beach, Muchangpo Beach, and floating islands spread far and wide. The crow often flies in the distant landscape, but the name Oseosan originated from the many crows since ancient times. There is a theory that when you look at Oeyeon Island, a long distance from the land, you can see the mountain black and named it Oseo Mountain.
Landscape of Oseosan at sunset with silver grass, sea and plains
If you want a more dramatic scenery, I recommend going along the ridge about 1km from the top to Oseojeong. There is a wide viewing deck, so you can relax.
Landscape of Oseosan at sunset with silver grass, sea and plains
If you return to the Natural Recreation Forest, you can take the Hassan-gil toward Gongdeok Pass near the top. This is the road leading to the parking lot of the natural recreation forest. Compared to Woljeongsa Temple, the slope is gentle and you can go down comfortably.
Oseosan Natural Recreation Forest
If you can afford it, you can stay in Oseosan Natural Recreation Forest for a day. It is located in a dense forest along the Myeongdae Valley, so you can stay quietly. The bamboo forest path and forest experience path behind the forest training center are good for a morning walk.
Bamboo forest in Oseosan Natural Recreation Forest

item.title: Drive trip while looking at Anmyeondo - Boryeong, Chungnam, Korea
item.description:
bow

Drive trip while looking at Anmyeondo

Boryeong, Chungnam, Korea

The most common way to get to Taemyeon's Anmyeondo is to cross the Seosan AB district shelter from Hongseong IC of the West Coast Expressway. If you follow the coastal road south of Gongnipo-gu before Seosan AB Earthquake began, the Namdang Port and Cheonbuk Guldan are well known for their fresh and abundant seafood, as well as Hongseong's Sokdong Observatory, Hongseong Embankment Observatory, and Chungcheongsu Swimming Coastal Observatory. Meet the observation deck that contains scenery. Also waiting for meaningful landmarks, such as Chungcheong-Soo-Sungseong, which was called Ocheon-Sung, the tomb of Dr. Lee Ji-Ham, the protagonist of 《Tojeong Secrets》, and Madam Shrine of Baekje. Enjoy a drive tour along the coasts of Hongseong and Boryeong, overlooking Anmyeondo Island.
Coastal road running along Anmyeondo Island, from Gongnipogu to Namdang Port
Most of the tourists who enter the Anmyeondo with the excitement of the summer trip come out of the Honghae IC of the West Coast Expressway and cross the Seosan AB district. But just before crossing the seawall, let's run from Hari Intersection towards the coastal road. It doesn't lead to a single road, but most can run along the sea from Hongseong to Boryeong. It is a road running to the left with only Cheonsu and looking at Anmyeondo, which is like a long and long belt.
If you get off at the Hari Intersection just before crossing the Seosan AB District Embankment, Imhae Tourist Road begins. Imhae Tourist Road is a 16km road from Bugi-ri, Galsan-myeon to Mokhyeon-ri, Eunhae. Among them, 4.1 km from Gongni to Eosari in Seomyeon-myeon is called the West Coast Imhae Tourist Road. It is a beautiful coastal road that extends across the bay.
Scenery at low tide on Mulli Beach
Gongnipogu, a secluded fishing village at the start of the West Coast Imhae Tourist Road, welcomes you first. The wide open mudflat is peaceful just by looking at it. The fishermen who live in the open tideland are also seen. In Gongnipo-gu, there is 'Cheonsu Bay Hanul Floor' with sculptures for fishing on the roof. If you make a reservation here, you can enjoy natural fishing and cage fishing in the marine fishing park.
View from Sokdong Observatory
It is the Sokdong Observatory with the best view of the coastal road after passing Gongnipogu. It is a beautiful view point of Cheonsu Bay and Anmyeondo Island. Originally there was only a two-story observatory on the coast, but another observatory was installed on the small island, the island, in front of the observatory. Follow the deck path from Sokdong Observatory to Moseom and climb to the top of Moseom. It is called a “Titanic Observation Deck” because it is shaped like a small boat. The tideland of Cheonsuman Bay, where seawater has escaped, is a vast land. Ganwolam can be seen in the distance, and the long Anmyeondo along Cheonsuman Bay divides the sea and the sky. In Sokdong Tidal Flat Village, a tidal flat experience is also possible when the tide is right.
A place called the Titanic Observation Deck
On the coastal road, early cosmos adds to the excitement of a peer-driven trip. The West Coast Imhae Tourist Road passes at Sokdong Observatory and ends at Eosa Intersection. However, the drive tour continues along the National Highway No. 40 through the Namdang Port and Hongseong Dynasty.
Namdang Port Breakwater
Between the seawall and the seawall, from Hongseong seawall to Boryeong seawall
From the Eosa Intersection, take National Route 40 for about 2.5km and it is Namdang Port, famous for Daeha and the new clam. The seasonal seafood is also taking a break from tempo Han Gatjin July and August. Namdang Port, where the bustle has disappeared, is a quiet port that only passes quietly. If it's King Lee, go to the breakwater with a lighthouse that warmly surrounds Namdang Port. It is a breakwater that is large enough to have a two-lane road. When you get near the lighthouse, you can see the panoramic view of Namdang Port. Outside the breakwater, you can still see the long-lasting face and the close-up Jukdo. Jukdo Island floating in the middle of Cheonsu Bay and the orange roofs visible across the coast of Jukdo Island do not leave their eyes for a while.
Hongseong Embankment Observatory
If you pass Namdang Port, you will be off the coast, but it is also the sea for a while. This time, a unique structure emerges. It is a Hongseong Embankment built on the border between Hongseong and Boryeong. On the way from Hongseong to Boryeong, there are two seawalls, which are the Hongseong Fortress that connects Seomyeon-myeon, Hongseong-gun, and Cheonbuk-myeon, Boryeong-si, and Boryeong, which connects Cheonbuk-myeon, Boryeong-si and Ocheon-myeon, Boryeong-si.
Panoramic view of Hongseong Embankment. The other side is Cheonbukgul Complex
When you climb the mountain at the entrance of the Hongseong Embankment, the completion tower of the Hongseong · Boryeong Embankment stands. At the end of the mountain is an observation deck overlooking the Hongseong Embankment. It overlooks the Cheonbuk Guldan Complex, famous for its long straight seawall and oysters. Jukdo Island, which was seen horizontally from the Namdang Port, is more three-dimensional when viewed from the observation deck. On the back side of Jukdo Island, Anmyeondo surrounded like a folding screen.
Completed tower of Hongseong · Boryeong Seawall
Chungcheong swimming coastal observatory and Chungcheong swimming
As soon as you cross the Boryeong Seawall and turn right, there is a special attraction. It is the observatory of Chungcheong-Suyeong coastal landscape built on the hillside. ‘Palsaek Boryeong Essay’ refers to eight themes of 《Gwanchon Essay》 by Boryeong Born novelist Lee Mun-gu.
Chungcheong Swim Coastal Observatory from the Boryeong Dynasty
Crossing the road from the parking lot leads to the observatory. It is about 500m to the observatory, and you can climb a steep mountain path for about 20 minutes.
Chungcheong Swim Coast Observation Deck
There are two observation decks. The lower part is an overhanging observatory that protrudes out into the air, and the upper part is another viewing point that can be overlooked from a higher point. Below, the Boryeong Embankment, Chungcheongsuseongseong, Ocheon Port, and Anmyeondo Island and the West Sea are visible. From the observation deck, you can see the ridge of Oseo Mountain from the northeast.
Ocheon Port and Chungcheong Swimming
Bingdo inside the toxic Boryeong Embankment catches the eye. This is the place where Domi and Ms. Domi, who were in the family due to the tyranny of King Gaero of Baekje, left for Goguryeo by boat. There is a dormitory shrine at the foot of the mountain on the northeast side of the observation deck.
A stunning 2nd floor observatory at the Chungcheong swimming coastal observatory
From the observatory parking lot to the port of Ocheon, it is a long time. There remains a historic site No. 501 Chungcheong-Sungseong, originally called Ocheonseong in Ocheon Port. Only the west gate of the castle has a rainbow-shaped trace of Hongyemun, where you can take a look around Chungcheong-Sungseong. The scenery of the Ocheon Port and the Boryeong Seawall from here is quite beautiful.
Hongyemun, the entrance to Chungcheong Suyeongseong
At the entrance to Ocheonseong, there is 'Oyangson Kalguksu', which is well-known as Bajirak Kalguksu and Bibimbuksu. The sun-dried lotus root is made with noodle, which is then ripened, and the thick, chewy noodles are good for bibimbap or clam noodles. In addition to spicy noodles and bibimbap noodles, soybean noodles are also served in summer. It is also unique to have a menu that allows you to taste two noodles together, like Jjajangmyeon and Jjambyeon, which you can taste in half.
Boryeong View from Chungcheong-Sooseong
If you run behind Ocheon Port, you will see Galmaemot Holy Land after a while. If you pass here, the road will be far from the sea, and after a long run through the Tomb of Mr. Lee Ji-ham, you will enter the city of Boryeong.
Biyang and Noodles from Oyang Son Kalguksu

item.title: Autumn leaves left by yellow leaves, Cheongna bank village - Boryeong, South Korea
item.description:
Ginkgo biloba shedding leaves already

Autumn leaves left by yellow leaves, Cheongna bank village

Boryeong, South Korea

Autumn begins in heaven and ends on earth. Looking at the clear sky without a cloud, we realize that autumn has come. Autumn is in full swing as you look at the colorful leaves colored in the air. And looking at the carpeted land where falling rain drops fall, we feel that autumn is about to leave. Choosing to enjoy autumn until the last moment when it runs from the air to the ground is Cheongna Bank Village in Boryeong-si, Chungnam.
The largest ginkgo colony in Korea
Enters Cheongna Bank Village, located at the foot of Oseo Mountain, Cheong Ramyeon, Boryeong-si. Even in early November, autumn is in full swing. Some ginkgo trees have begun to drop ginkgo biloba due to their temper, but there are still many ginkgo trees that are slowly green.
Ginkgo leaves seem to be a week slower than any other year because of heat and drought, the locals say. This year, you will be able to enjoy the yellow waves of Cheongna Bank Village until a little later.
Ginkgo tree still green
Cheongna Bank Village looks like the largest ginkgo grove in Korea. Ginkgo trees come in from the village entrance to the snow. It is not an exaggeration to say that over 3,000 ginkgo trees are growing in the village.
Cheongna Ginkgo Village
How did Ginkgo live here? The legend of the village is told. Since ancient times, Janghyeon Village (Cheongna Bank Village) has been called Oseosan because there are many crows. A yellow pit lived by a small pond under the mountain. The worm prayed for ease every day for a thousand years. On the day of the millennium, the goblin finally became Hwang Ryong and ascended with Yeouiju. Crows around Oseo-san watched this scene. Later, the crows looked for food, found a yellow bank, and thought that it was Yeoui-ju, which Hwang was biting. That is why Ginkgo trees are now inhabited in Janghyeon village.
Ginkgo trees can be found anywhere in town
Apart from the legend, there are also entities that reveal the origin of Cheongna Bank Village. It is a 500-year-old Sugo tree in front of the nerve house (Chungcheongnam-do Cultural Heritage No. 291). The ginkgo trees of Cheongna Bank Village are almost dark trees. After a round of town, the smell from the tip of the shoe proves this. The 500-year-old ginkgo biloba has played a role in bringing the fruit of many dark trees in the Cheongna ginkgo village.
Walking through the village, you can see the drying up of the banks.
Ginkgo trees that are aesthetically cultivated in the city have many trees that do not bear fruit, but in rural areas, they grow many trees that bear fruit because their purpose is for living. At one time, the villagers called ginkgo trees as 'college trees'. When the bank quotes were good, a few trees helped me get my college tuition.
You can buy banks in town in the fall.
Although the value of the bank is not so great now, it is still a good source of income for the residents of Cheongna Bank Village. It is known that the amount of banks held in Cheongna Bank Village alone is over 100 tons. The nickname of 'Bank town with a bank' is not just funny.
You can buy banks in town in the fall.
A round of bank town of 'Trial History'
You don't have to worry about where to look around the Cheongna Bank Village. It's enough to walk along the road around town.
Bank village round road sign
Ginkgo trees stand along the fields, along the streams and along the earthen houses. There is no artificial feeling. It's as natural as it is. That is because the Cheongna Bank Village is not a place for planting and decorating Ginkgo trees to show people. As the villagers planted and grown a lot of ginkgo trees, they became known for the autumn leaves and tourists began to visit.
Closed Janghyeon Elementary School transformed into a green farming experience
Because it is not an artificially created tourist spot, there is no large parking lot. The park is set up at the old Janghyeon Elementary School or Jeongchon Organic Farm, which is used as a green farming experience center in the bank village. Rural scenery of the village and the ginkgo trees scattered here and there complete the scenery in autumn.
House of old houses and old trees are the best place to live
The points of the bank villages are Sinseop House and Jeongchon Organic Farm. Among them, Sinseop house is the best rice in the bank village. The house is a hanok, the late Joseon Dynasty. Around the old house are ginkgo trees over 100 years old. Dignity can be felt in the landscape of old-fashioned houses and trees. At first glance, it's too bad to see it. It is fun to look thirsty outside. When thirsty for the intact landscape is at its peak, spraying the yard takes its foot. It's as if you're walking into a single elegant painting. The scenery of thirsty staring outside the fence and the view from the courtyard are attractive.
House of old houses and old trees are the best place to live
Jeongchon Organic Farm provides another flavor. The center is equipped with a small ecological park, a hanok pension and a rural healing cafe.
Jeongchon Organic Farm Yard Surrounded by Beautiful Ginkgo Trees
The yard, surrounded by beautiful ginkgo trees, is perfect to feel the fall. Ginkgo leaves full of trees flutter in the wind and fall one by one.
Jeongchon Organic Farm Yard provides a comfortable resting place in autumn
During the autumn, when the ginkgo trees are yellow, there is a snack market at the café and a small produce market in the yard.
Jeongchon Organic Farm Yard is full of cute autumn items
Banks, sweet potatoes, and chestnuts harvested from Jeongchon Organic Farm are often delicious jeonjuburi in autumn.
Jeongchon Organic Farm Yard is full of cute autumn items
The annual Cheongna Bank Village Festival is held from late October to early November. During the festival, there are various experience programs centered on the former Janghyeon Elementary School. This year's festival took place on October 29 and 30. The festival is over, but don't be afraid. The peak of autumn leaves has not passed since this year's bank leaves were late. Rather, the village's advice is that from the first weekend in November to the second week of the week, you can savor the yellow waves of the Cheongna bank village. It would be great to visit Cheongna Bank Village during the best time to see autumn leaves, but it may be a little early or a little late. The lush peaks of the beautiful ginkgo trees are beautiful, but the mysterious moment of the transition from fresh green to yellow is also fascinating.
A rustic country village becomes special with ginkgo in autumn

item.title: Boryeong, South Korea - A few hours spent alone at Treasure Island Chamber of Hanok
item.description:
You can enjoy the sea and hanok scenery at the Sanghwa Garden.

A few hours spent alone at Treasure Island Chamber of Hanok

Boryeong, South Korea

Hanok entered the island. The tree that guarded the island wrapped up the old house after it was declared. Man reached out and made his way and made a pond. The sea from the island was harmonious and named it Sanghwawon. It is the story of a garden on Jukdo. Because of the beautiful scenery, rumors spread across the island. If you're eager to avoid the heat and quiet alone, head to Boryeong-si Jukhwa Garden.
The whole island becomes a garden
It takes about 10 minutes to Jukdo after getting off at Daecheon Station on Janghang Line. The island, originally floating on the West Sea, was connected with land by roads for reclamation. Although once in danger of development, the island owner's insistence on maintaining the nature of Jukdo could be preserved.
The owner pondered a meaningful way to protect the island. It was decided to create a garden named Sanghwawon with the meaning of worshiping harmony. Jukdo was determined not to hurt the nature. What did you think about bringing hanok to the island? The encounter between the two, which felt only heterogeneous, was exquisite when I think about it today. Visitors were happy to meet an unexpected Hanok on the island. It was a hanok that prolonged life in front of the crisis.
Lee Dae Cheong House
Wherever in the Sangwon Garden, the sea seems to be in your hands. Dense forests on the road and shoulders are enough to hide. If the crowded destination is burdensome, the Sangwon House is a wonderful hideaway that will make my whereabouts brief.
Hong's house door
Walk the path of the Sangwon Garden
It takes about an hour and a half to roam the whole house. Need to hurry up to the island? Let's set aside the haste. As you enter the Sanghwawon, you will see a handsome Hanok in front of you. It is Uigo Hall. It is a hanok that was built to be used as sperm in Hwaseong Gwana, Gyeonggi-do. It is assumed that it was built during the late Goryeo or early Joseon Dynasty. Before moving to the upper house, he pitched his tent and wrote it as a coffee shop. If you didn't come here for preservation, the house would have been demolished.
Uigok Hall is currently used as a visitor center. Provide a simple drink and rice cake to the audience. Note that there are no restaurants or stalls inside the Sanghwawon. If you do not have enough water to drink, you can use the bottled water stand on the corridor.
The Sanghwawon viewing starts from the right side with the back of the entrance. Walk along the corridor over 1 km. Give your eyes a green leafy hack before heading to the cloister.
